intro: Corydalis pterophora, commonly known as the winged corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of western China and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Corydalis pterophora is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and is often cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil.
